result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steve C. Montalto

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
4:01 p.m. Defendant Steve C. Montalto in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf95, 14cm22, 15cm165. Schiek files letter agreement that outlines plea agreement. Plea questionaire filed. State moves to dismiss but read in for purposes of restitution 14cm22 and 15cm165 - Granted. State moves to amend Counts 2, 3 and 4 to Misdemeanor Theft, a violation of 943.20(1)(b) & (3)(a) - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim impact statements filed. Schiek/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence-each count
WHS/POP - 3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Restitution - as outlined in letter agreement provided by Schiek
Jail credit - 31 days
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 4:37 p.m.

3:36 p.m. Defendant Steve C. Montalto in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf95, 14cm22 and 15cm165. Voorhees in receipt of Information - waive reading - enters not guilty pleas -  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm. Adj. 3:38 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

Tracking w/15CF95 - Voorhees/Schiek in agreement with modification of bond to signature bond. Court questions defendant's residence. Voorhees statement--residence is unknown at this time/in Rhinelander with family and/or friends. Voorhees speaks to status of Lincoln & Shawano County cases. Court statement to bond considerations--grants $10,000 sig. bond.

3:04 p.m. Defendant Steve C. Montalto in court with attorney John E Voorhees, both appearing via video.  Defendant Steve C. Montalto in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf95, 15cm165 and 14cm22.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Voorhees/Michlig statement to bail modification. Court denies motion to modify bond.
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 28, 2025 at 11:30 am. Adj. 3:13 p.m.

9:07 a.m. Defendant Steve C. Montalto in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14cm22, 15cm165, 15cf95. In receipt of complaint. Court questions defendant concerning prior representation by attorneys.  Defendant states he had contacted PD's office and is eligible. Defendant believes that Attorney Voorhees has been appointed.  Court tells defendant that if he obtains representation, attorney should contact Judicial Assistant for new date.
Bail continued.Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Adj. 09:16 a.m.
Confirmed with Mary- defendant was transported on CF case and then served CM warrants

1:37 p.m. Defendant Steve C. Montalto in court, via video, in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cm22, 15cf95, 15cm165.   In 15cf95 and 15cm165, in receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $10,000 cash bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
